title: Orchard planted by non-community member
vignette: An orchard was planted by a non-community member but sold to a community member before the first fruits matured. Does it qualify for first fruits offering?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Qualifies; the current community-specific owner bears the obligation.', 'tags': ['religious-duty']}
options.1: {'id': 'B', 'text': 'Disqualifies; original planting by a non-community member taints the produce.', 'tags': ['property-rights']}

title: Orchard sold to non-community member then reacquired
vignette: An orchard planted by a community member was sold to a non-community member, then later repurchased by a community member before harvest. Does it qualify for first fruits offering?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Qualifies; final community-specific ownership restores its status.', 'tags': ['religious-duty']}

title: Sharecropper’s first fruits offering
vignette: A sharecropper cultivates land owned by another community member. Who must bring the first fruits?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Sharecropper; he did the work and harvested the fruit.', 'tags': ['responsibility']}

title: Co-owned orchard by community member and non-community member
vignette: An orchard is jointly owned by a community member and a non-community member. Do its fruits qualify for first fruits offering?

options.1: {'id': 'B', 'text': 'Disqualifies; any non-community-specific stake disqualifies the produce.', 'tags': ['property-rights']}

title: Returnee’s recitation
vignette: An Israelite who lived abroad then returned brings first fruits offering. Should he recite the standard “which You gave our ancestors” formula or a modified version?

title: Convert’s confession
vignette: A convert stands among first fruits offering presenters. Must he recite a unique confession acknowledging his personal redemption or the standard communal declaration?

title: Impure presenter carrying basket
vignette: A man who is ritually impure from corpse-tumah brings his first fruits offering basket to the Temple Mount. May he leave the basket there and depart without entering?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Yes; the basket may be placed even if he cannot ascend.', 'tags': ['personal-agency']}

title: Deaf-mute gesture blessings
vignette: A presenter is deaf-mute and cannot recite the blessing verbally. Should he use gestures to fulfill the obligation?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Yes; gestures suffice to convey the required intent.', 'tags': ['personal-agency']}
options.1: {'id': 'B', 'text': 'No; verbal recitation is mandated by law.', 'tags': ['religious-duty']}

title: Double designation of first fruits
vignette: A farmer ties a reed band around a fruit to mark it as first fruits. Must he also repeat that designation after picking it?

options.0: {'id': 'A', 'text': 'Yes; both field-marking and post-harvest declaration are required.', 'tags': ['due-process', 'religious-duty']}
